name: whatness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of something that makes it what it is and different from other things: The whatness of an object is established by the impression it creates upon a person's mind. I found it hard to describe the whatness of the piece; it was an ordinary abstract painting, yet it was like something I had never seen before.
More examplesFewer examplesThe power of the band resides not in the band itself or its music, but in its whatness - that idea that no other band can replicate. Plato's Theory of Forms says that all things have an essence that determines the whatness of the thing - for example, what makes a horse a horse.
